translation:
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

I inform Your Excellency that the Jacuí river was commanded by Quartermaster Joaquim Rodrigues, the plan having failed because the rebel Manuel Alz. marched with full force towards the coast of the Jacuí river.

The rebel José Romão Taborda, arrested in the previous sortie, was delivered under the orders of Your Excellency.

God keep Your Excellency Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Tomás José da Silva. Marshal and Commander of the Garrison of Porto Alegre. Barracks in the town of Triunfo, February 16, 1845. Antônio Pedro de Abreu Major in charge of gathering the soldiers of the 8th Brigade.
